page.title: 01ST. CLEOPAS SCHOOL
page.content: Our school is called{St. Cleopas {School.}There has been a St. Cleopas School on this site since 1871. St. Cleopas church was a famous local landmark with its very tall spire. The church was demolished this year as extensive repairs were required which were too expensive to carry out. Our school is a modern single storey building of an Open - Plan design. We are a{Church of England}Junior and Infant Mixed school. Our school has a reputation for work in{Science,} {Environmental Studies and Computers.} We have been involved, this year, in work for a Primary Computing Fair, a local Art and Craft exhibition and a choral performance at the Liverpool Festival Gardens (the re-opened International Garden Festival.)
